me.appfriends.sdk

Interface DialogService


  • public interface DialogService
    A service to provide dialog related functions Created by Hacknocraft LLC on 2016-12-08.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • addMembersToDialog

        @Deprecated
rx.Observable<java.lang.Boolean> addMembersToDialog(java.lang.String dialogId,
                                                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> dialogMembers)
        Deprecated. 
        Will be removed from SDK version 3.2.0 onwards

        Use addUsersToDialog(String, List) instead

        Add additional users / members to a group dialog
        Parameters:
        dialogId - dialog id
        dialogMembers - a non-null, non-empty list of user ids to be added to a group dialog
        Returns:
        an Observable of the created dialog

      • leaveDialog

        @Deprecated
rx.Observable<java.lang.Boolean> leaveDialog(java.lang.String dialogId,
                                                         Dialog.DialogType dialogType)
        Deprecated. 
        Will be removed from SDK version 3.2.0 onwards

        Use deleteDialog(String, Dialog.DialogType) instead

        Removes the current user from a group dialog or deletes a private dialog.

        All locally stored messages associated with the dialog will be removed
        Parameters:
        dialogId - dialog id
        dialogType - the type of the dialog the current user is trying to leave
        Returns:
        an Observable of the status

      • updateDialog

        @Deprecated
rx.Observable<java.lang.Boolean> updateDialog(java.lang.String dialogId,
                                                          java.lang.String dialogName)
        Deprecated. 
        Will be removed from SDK version 3.2.0 onwards

        Use updateDialogName(String, String) instead

        Updates the current group dialog's name
        Parameters:
        dialogId - dialog id
        dialogName - new name
        Returns:
        aan Observable of the status

      • updateDialog

        @Deprecated
rx.Observable<java.lang.Boolean> updateDialog(java.lang.String dialogId,
                                                          boolean mute)
        Deprecated. 
        Will be removed from SDK version 3.2.0 onwards

        Use muteDialog(String, boolean) instead

        Change the mute status of a dialog, muted dialog will not result in any push messages
        Parameters:
        dialogId - dialog id
        mute - flat indicating whether to mute the dialog or not
        Returns:
        an Observable of the created dialog

      • getDialogs

        rx.Observable<java.util.List<Dialog>> getDialogs()
        Retrieves and observes all individual and group Dialogs the current user is participating in
        Returns:
        a non-completing Observable with an updating list of all Dialogs

      • getDialog

        rx.Observable<Dialog> getDialog(java.lang.String dialogId)
        Retrieves and observes the Dialog with the id dialogId
        Parameters:
        dialogId - id of the dialog the user is trying to enter
        Returns:
        a non-completing Observable that will continuously update as the dialog is updated

      • createDialog

        rx.Observable<Dialog> createDialog(java.lang.String dialogName,
                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> dialogMembers)
        Creates a dialog
        Parameters:
        dialogName - name of the dialog to be created (if applicable)
        dialogMembers - a non-null and non-empty list of user ids to be included in this dialog, if only a single user id is supplied, a private conversation is created
        Returns:
        an Observable of the created dialog

      • createDialog

        rx.Observable<Dialog> createDialog(java.lang.String dialogName,
                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> dialogMembers,
                                   @Nullable
                                   java.lang.String customData,
                                   @Nullable
                                   java.lang.String pushData)
        Creates a dialog with custom data as well as push data
        Parameters:
        dialogName - name of the dialog to be created (if applicable)
        dialogMembers - a non empty list of user ids to be included in this dialog, if only a single user id is supplied, a private conversation is created
        customData - custom string containing any custom data you wish to be included in the dialog
        pushData - string containing push data needed for group dialog creation
        Returns:

      • addUsersToDialog

        rx.Completable addUsersToDialog(java.lang.String dialogId,
                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> dialogMembers)
        Add additional users to a group dialog
        Parameters:
        dialogId - dialog id
        dialogMembers - a non-null, non-empty list of user ids to be added to a group dialog
        Returns:
        an Observable of the created dialog

      • deleteDialog

        rx.Completable deleteDialog(java.lang.String dialogId,
                            Dialog.DialogType dialogType)
        Removes the current user from a group dialog or deletes a private dialog.

        All locally stored messages associated with the dialog will be removed
        Parameters:
        dialogId - ID of the dialog the user is trying to leave
        dialogType - type of the dialog the user is trying to leave from
        Returns:
        a Completable that complets when the current user has successfully left a dialog

      • updateDialogName

        rx.Completable updateDialogName(java.lang.String dialogId,
                                java.lang.String dialogName)
        Updates the current group dialog's name
        Parameters:
        dialogId - dialog id
        dialogName - new name
        Returns:
        aan Observable of the status

      • muteDialog

        rx.Completable muteDialog(java.lang.String dialogId,
                          boolean mute)
        Change the mute status of a dialog, muted dialog will not result in any push messages
        Parameters:
        dialogId - dialog id
        mute - flat indicating whether to mute the dialog or not
        Returns:
        an Observable of the created dialog

        Sets a receiver of typing indicator events
        Parameters:
        dialogId - id of the dialog
        receiver - receiver that implments
